fields.description: Can we have an extra field on the *Access Control* - *Add or remove IP addresses* page that allows us to give names to each of our allowed IP addresses? It's impossible to organize and keep track of ip addresses without having an external doc.
fields.summary: Access Control - IP Whitelist add names/notes to entries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Possible bug in tag api call and pagenation that auto generates a wrong api call to the next page to not work. The format of the resultant API call is wrong.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # First API call is like this
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/XXXXX/XXXXXX/refs/tags?pagelen=100
This will return the tags and an API call for the next page similar to 
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/XXXX/XXXXXX/refs/tags?pagelen=100&page=67sER
 # If you run the second API call, it will still keep you in first page, but if you switch the last part where the pagelen comes last, then you can move to page 2, like this;
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/XXXXX/XXXXXXXX/refs/tags?page=67sER&pagelen=100

h3. Expected Results
The api call that is generated from the first API call should be good to move to Page 2. 

h3. Actual Results

We need to change the API call to move to page 2.

h3. Workaround

Workaround as mentioned above is to switch the page information and pagelen from:
{{pagelen=100&page=67sER}}
to:
{{page=67sER&pagelen=100}}
fields.summary: API 2.0 Call for Tags issue when combined with Pagenation Pagelen

fields.description:
Customer wants to have a way in which they can update Pull Request Descriptions and Pull request tasks for the entire team at once, *preferably under team administration*
This will help save time when managing multiple repositories and not having to do it one at a time. 

But, a user should also be able to override these (description and task) at repository level, as it is now. 

So basically, one way to update PR Description and PR Tasks for an entire team, while maintaining the ability to set at individual repository level.

Kindly assist. 
Regards
Manu Abraham
fields.summary: Pull Request Description Update across Multiple Repositories

fields.description:
Automate Git LFS action in Bitbucket when mirroring a repository from another repository, e.g. Github.

They clone the repo locally, and then track the files and push it back again for LFS to start.

Need a way to eliminate the additional steps and instead have an option to implement the LFS feature after the mirroring is done.

For reference, here are the steps taken for mirroring;
# Navigate to your project's Settings > Repository and expand the *Mirroring repositories* section.
# Enter a repository URL.
# Select Push from the Mirror direction dropdown.
# Select an authentication method from the Authentication method dropdown, if necessary.
# Check the Only mirror protected branches box, if necessary.
# Click the Mirror repository button to save the configuration.
fields.summary: Automate Git LFS while Mirroring from another repository

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the new Pull Request UI enabled, there is an "Activity" section on the right that displays the PR activities. 

By default, it's displayed in the correct chronological order. However, when the PR gets updated (new commits / comments .etc), you'll see a notification asking you to Reload the PR. Clicking that PR link will reload the PR with the new changes. However, the list of activities will no longer be in a chronological order. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure New Pull Request Experience is enabled on Bitbucket Labs
# Create a new PR or open any existing PR (Leave this tab open)
# Push a new commit to the PR
# Check the PR tab again and you'll see a notification to Reload the PR
# Click that link and take note on the PR activity list that they're not in the correct order.

h3. Expected Results

# PR Activity list to be in the correct chronological order

h3. Actual Results

# PR Activity list does not list activities in the correct order as per this screenshot. Take note on the activity time.

 !Screenshot 2019-11-14 at 10.03.36 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

# Performing a full page refresh of the Pull Request will workaround this issue.
fields.summary: Pull Request Activity list out of chronological when PR gets new updates

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare a repo that has wiki enabled
# Navigate to dashboard(https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview) and click the repo of 1
# Edit the wiki page
# Head back to the dashboard and check the repo list

h3. Expected Results
The repo with wiki updated is listed at the top

h3. Actual Results
The repo order doesn't change
fields.summary: Update "Last Updated" column for wiki updates

fields.description: Option to automatically assign our code reviews to teammates depending on their workload.
fields.summary: Automatically assigned code reviews

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The _last used_ column of Access keys for a repository is not being updated with date a key was last used. Keys are shown as never used even after being used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an access key on a repository
 # Use it to clone said repository

h3. Expected Results
The _last used_ column being updated with the last time the key was used.

h3. Actual Results
The _last used_ column shows as _never used_

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using an access key does not update its last used information on the repository settings

fields.description:
Access keys have read-only access to repositories, but cloning a repository wiki is not supported.
{code}
$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:gattino/wikiaccesskey/wiki
Cloning into 'wiki'...
accessing wiki via a access key is not supported
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

I would be good to have the ability to clone a repository wiki using access keys.
fields.summary: Allow using access keys to clone Wiki

fields.description:
Description:
Users would like email alias to be valid email addresses when accepting team invitations

Use case:
A developer signs contracts as a freelancer with multiple clients, for each client he wants to use a different email address which are correctly setup as Email Alias for his account.

Current behavior:
User is unable to accept the team invitation as Bitbucket does not recognize/link to the account which the email used is set as an Alias.
fields.summary: Users would like email alias to be valid email addresses when accepting team invitations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The formatting in the inline comments section of PR is not working correctly in the Swedish keyboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Pull request.
 # Go to a file and click + to add inline comments on the file.
 #  Type `.Text` 
 # The text is converted to code format `Text` But the dot (.) is missing when it changes to code format.

h3. Expected Results

The text should be converted to code format correctly as below

`.Text`  is converted to .Text

 
h3. Actual Results

`.Text`  is converted to `Text`
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The formatting in the inline comments section of PR is not working correctly in the Swedish keyboard.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, wiki pages need to be created manually one by one. It would be great if wiki pages could be imported from other systems, like for example Confluence, which already has the ability to export pages. 
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround for importing pages at the moment. Each page will need to be recreated manually in the Bitbucket wiki.
fields.summary: Ability to import pages in the wiki

fields.description:
When reviewing a Pull Request, it is not immediately obvious when (how old) the PR is, when it was last updated, nor by whom. It takes an additional click into Activity and some scrolling just in order discern this snapshot info.

I propose adding Created Date, Last Updated Date, and Last Updated by Whom to the Pull Request Header somewhere visible and obvious: Right sidebar as part of and at the first items around build stats, Story Id, "stop watching" meta actions/info block would make fine sense to me in my use case.

*Use Case 1:*

As a developer tasked with reviewing 30 concurrent PRs, it is helpful to take a look at any open PR and be able to determine just how old it is at a glance, where longevity can help imply priority/urgency.

 

*Use Case 2:*

As a developer tasked with reviewing 30 concurrent PRs, when revisiting an open PR with revisions, it is helpful to be able to see at a glance whether the PR was updated  since it was last reviewed.
fields.summary: Add Created Date, Last Updated Date, and Last Updated by Whom to Pull Request Header somewhere

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pipeline build fails without logging any error on UI when executed using a 'run-as-user' directive with the docker image not correctly configured for the mentioned user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run pipelines build with 'run-as-user' set to UID which isn't available in the image
 # For the following configuration:

{panel}
image:
     name: atlassian/default-image:latest
     *run-as-user: 1002*
 pipelines:
    default:
        - step:
               name: Run tests 
               script:
                   - echo "test"
{panel}
It fails without logging any error:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-12 at 7.02.08 PM.png|width=595,height=71!

 
h3. Expected Results

UI should ideally log errors
h3. Actual Results

No error logged in the UI
h3. Workaround

Run build using root users
fields.summary: Pipelines build fails without logging errors when executed by non-root user

fields.description:
The current workflow we have in place is that, whenever an issue is resolved, set on hold or is no more relevant from being assigned to us, we go to edit and modify the "assignee" value to ensure that the person relevant to the issue now will have visibility of the task.

Having to always access the edit screen to achieve this becomes painful over time. We believe it would be relevant to have the ability to modify the assignee from the issue screen, similar to how it is possible to alter the workflow status and such.
fields.summary: Ability to edit assignee from issue main screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currenty in the Bitbucket UI, we have an option to copy past a pre-set command to checkout a branch 

!image-2019-11-12-13-26-56-581.png!

This would not work with a branch that already has a hashtag at the beginning of its name, like #123. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a branch #123 -> Git branch "#123" (in CLI)
 # Move this to the remote repository.
 # Try to checkout in the UI, the preset command generated would be *git fetch && git checkout #123* -> This will not work, because the branch name would resolve to 123.
 # The preset copy commands should generate with double quotes, "" around the branch name to include the symbols. Something similar to *git fetch && git checkout "#123"*
 # **The above format would include symbols as well.
fields.summary: Copy Checkout Command in Bitbucket UI with Quotes

fields.description:
Currently, when you integrate Slack Notifications with Bitbucket, we can only set the Deployment Status which will include all deployment environments. 

It would be a useful feature to allow users to customise the notifications to be sent for a specific deployment environment. 

This will help when differentiating the notification status between environments.
fields.summary: Feature for Slack Notifications for specific Deployment Environment

fields.description:
As a developer, I often make updates which result in a change to an output or similar.

I would love to be able to create something like a snippet but showing the diff between two supplied files.

For example, I am currently migrating a service. My new code produces an output, and I would like to easily share the difference between the new output and the old output.
fields.summary: Snippet-style diffs

fields.description:
Hello,

We are an application, which makes it easier for Bitbucket Teams to manage and install php composer packages. Bitbucket customers create a Bitbucket App Password and give it to us to use our services with their repositories.

We have multiple servers from which we make requests against the Bitbucket API and the IP of these servers can change at any time. This becomes an issue when customers enable the premium access control feature in Bitbucket Cloud which requires IPs to be whitelisted. Our (and your) customers then have to manually add and remove IPs every time they change on our side.

Firewalls support external dynamic lists where a url links to a text file from which the firewall can import objects e.g. IP addresses, URLs, domains and update the firewall accordingly.

We would welcome the addition of such a feature to the access control IP whitelisting.

Best,
Stephan
fields.summary: IP Whitelist: add support for external dynamic list same as firewall supports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Pull requests page of the repo shows a spinner, when:
 * The user is logged out of bitbucket.org
 * The user is logged in but they don't have access to the repo in question
 * The repo in question does not exist

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This has been reproduced with the latest version of Chrome, Firefox and Safari.

First scenario
1. Make sure you are logged out of bitbucket.org
2. Open the PR page of one of your repos ([https://bitbucket.org/repo-owner/repo-slug/pull-requests/])

Second scenario
1. Make sure you are logged out of bitbucket.org
2. Open the PR page of a repo that doesn't exist ([https://bitbucket.org/repo-owner/repo-slug/pull-requests/])

Third scenario
1. While you are logged in bitbucket.org, try to open the PR page of a repo that doesn't exist

Fourth scenario
1. While you are logged in bitbucket.org, try to open the PR page of a repo that you don't have access to

h3. Expected Results

In the first scenario, the expected result would be a redirect to id.atlassian.com so that the user logs in.

In the second scenario, the expected result would be a page informing the user that "The link has no power here".

In the third scenario, the expected result would be a page informing the user that "The link has no power here"

In the fourth scenario, the expected result would be a page informing the user they don't have access to the repo.
h3. Actual Results

In all 4 scenarios, the actual result is a page with a spinner:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-11 at 15.33.25.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PR page of a repo shows a spinner

fields.description:
We would like Bitbucket to review the way admin role works. We believe that we should have a way to grant people access that cannot be revoked by another (disgruntled) user. 

The use case would be:
# Prevent an employee, that has admin access in a team account, from delete/remove other admins if he leaves the company, as they would potentially be losing all their work.
# Prevent users from deleting the team account without the consent of the company (either accidentally or intentionally).

Suggestion: If there was a way to either create a different role (superadmin or owner) that your access cannot be revoked or have a checkbox that prevents an admin user from being deleted or delete someone else (you can only remove yourself) it would also help.
fields.summary: Review the way admin role works for access deletion of other admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exclude files feature do not work if a pull request has too many file changes. The PR diff will timeout.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the repository containing the large diff pull request, click *Settings* > *Excluded files* in the Workflow section.
 # In the *Patterns* field, enter patterns to exclude from pull request diff views.
 # Click *Save*.

h3. Expected Results

Exclude files feature should work in a pull request even if the PR has too many file changes.
h3. Actual Results

Exclude files feature is not working. 
h3. Workaround

Review the diff locally then merge the pull request in the UI or over API.
 Decline the pull request, chunk it into smaller ones then view the merge.
fields.summary: Exclude files feature do not work with a large diff pull request

fields.description:
The Pull Request Reviewers and Participants are missing in REST API result but the documentation indicates they should be returned.
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/pullrequests/%7Btarget_user%7D]
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests#get]

It would be nice to update the REST APIs because we would like to make use of those fields/variables.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Pull Request Reviewers and Participants Fields Missing in REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a branch is created with a name that starts with letter "i" and you try to highlight it using the mouse pointer, it will highlight all the whole navigation tree along with the branch name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a branch with name ianything
 # Try to highlight its name using the mouse pointer 

h3. Expected Results
Only the branch name would be highlighted

h3. Actual Results
Navigation path along with the branch name is highlighted

h3. Workaround

Highlight the name using shift or triple clicking the branch name.
fields.summary: Highlighting a branch name that starts with letter "i" highlights all the navigation tree

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a repository, if we have an identical branch and tag name, the Bitbucket Cloud UI filters for branch and tag commits are giving a different data result.
 Additionally, if we use the "src" API 2.0 to view files for tag or branch, it gives an inconsistent data result.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new repo
 # Create, commit, and push a file
 # Create, commit, and push a file again
 # Create a tag and push the tag (e.g. tag_123)
 # Create a new branch in BB UI with the name "tag_123"
 # Once done, clone the repo with the specific branch "tag_123" in a new folder using: {{git clone <REPO_URL> --branch=tag_123}}
 # Create a file and commit
 # When we push, only use {{git push}} command

*Test Repo*: [https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/tags-testing]

Now, check the filters below:
 * Tag Commits: [https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/tags-testing/commits/tag/tag_123]
 * Branch Commits: [https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/tags-testing/commits/branch/tag_123]

We can see that the result is the same, but it shouldn't be.

Also, if we run the below API calls below, it shows only the same result, but again it shouldn't be.
{code:java}
curl -u username:password https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/srstaging/tags-testing/src/master/?fields=values.path

curl -u username:password https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/srstaging/tags-testing/src/tag_123/?fields=values.path

Result:
====
{"values":[{"path":"file_1.txt"},{"path":"file_2.txt"}]}
{code}
Compare the API results in BB UI (See below links):
 * [https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/tags-testing/src/master/] - 2 Files
 * [https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/tags-testing/src/tag_123/] - 3 Files

h3. Expected Results

The BB UI filters and API 2.0 results will show the correct data

h3. Actual Results

The BB UI filters and API 2.0 results aren't showing the correct data

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, we need to avoid identical branch and tag name as this will break the UI.
 We can also rename the existing tag by following the Git commands below:
 # Clone your repo
 # Delete the tag: {{git tag -d tag_123}}
 # Push the deleted tag: {{git push origin :refs/tags/tag_123}}
 # Checkout to the commit hash (where the identical name is): {{git checkout 6a7ee1f}}
 # Choose a new tag name: {{git tag new_tag}}
 # Push the new tag name: {{git push origin : new_tag}}
fields.summary: Identical name of a branch and tag breaks BB UI filters and API data

fields.description:
The way that anchors are implemented today don't really allow other commands to run within the same step the anchor was called. If an anchor is called within a step, only the commands defined in the anchor may run.

This feature request is to add the ability to add more commands to a step where an anchor is called, like this for example:
{code:java}
steps:
  - step: &step1
    name: "things"
    script: &doingStuff
        - echo "building"
 - step: 
    name: "doing stuff and more"
    script:
      <<: *doingStuff
      - echo "other commands"
{code}
fields.summary: Add the ability to use anchors and commands within the same step

fields.description:
Hello Team Atlassian,

I would love to suggest that I highly feel in need when reviewing the PRs when at middle or somewhere and want to go to top, there is no way but only scroll manually up. There should be a button to go to Top.

Also, it would be nice if the "Files" links keep at the top static while we scroll to anywhere down below. So, what we can is we can easily switch between files that were updated within the current under review PR.

Hope you got my point, feel free to contact me if you still need more clarification on that.

BR,

Saud
fields.summary: Scroll To Top Button Needed

fields.description:
Currently, if you create tasks in a PR, the New PR UI will list the tasks from top-down.

For example, if you create the below tasks:
 * Task 1
 * Task 2
 * Task 3

It will be displayed in a Pull Request as:
 * Task 3
 * Task 2
 * Task 1

*Feature Request*: It would be best if we could display task list in chronological order
fields.summary: Pull request task list in chronological order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As of now, if a Pull Request has 1 commit, the commit message will be used as the Pull Request title automatically by default.
 If a Pull Request has more than one commit, the branch name is used as the title by default and the commit messages will be used for the description. 

However, if the user changes the default title or default destination branch from master to some other branch,  now before saving if the page is refreshed, the title changes back to the default title. The title entered by the user is lost.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Create a Pull request
 # By default Pull request title is populated with the branch name or commit message depending on the number of commits.
 # Change the default title to something else.
 # Change the default destination branch from master to some other branch
 # Before saving, if we refresh the page, the PR title is changed back to the default tiltle and the destination branch is reset to master. 

h3. Expected Results

The changes made by the user should be displayed even after the page is refreshed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When you refresh the Pull Request page, the pull request title, destination branch are reset to default.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Provide ability in TEAM account to configure default project name so that new repositories will be automatically part of the default project.

Currently there is no option to configure default project name.
h3. Workaround

in Bitbucket UI user has to manually select the project from the drop down list while creating repository. in Bitbucket API, user has to specify the project name in the request body else repository will be assigned to arbitrary project.
fields.summary: Provide ability to configure default project for new repositories in TEAM account

fields.description:
Right now if I use a webhook point to Microsoft Teams it results in 400 because it returns:

 

Summary or Text is required.

Wondering if Bitbucket can quickly come up with a fix on this so we can use MS Teams to receive event hooks?
fields.summary: Support Webhooks in MS Teams format

fields.description:
It would be very useful to automatically remove team members after a user defined period of inactivity on team repositories. 

This would reduce the number of team members that are being paid for. 

Slack automatically does this for users to keep the user pool down.
fields.summary: Automatically remove users from a Team after a period of Inactivity on Team Repositories

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There should be a way to export and import (migrate) issues from Bitbucket Cloud Issues into Jira Software Cloud.

You can export issues from Bitbucket as JSON, and you can import issues into Jira as JSON, but the two formats are not compatible so the import will fail.

Jira Cloud has an equivalent Bug for this issue: JRACLOUD-67311

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Bitbucket Cloud go to *Settings* > *Issues* > *Import & export*.
# Press *Start export* button.
# Download JSON when prompted.
# In Jira Software Cloud go to *Jira settings* > *System* > *External System Import*.
# Select [JSON importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html].
# Upload JSON when prompted.

h3. Expected Results
Issues should successfully import into Jira.

h3. Actual Results
Import fails as the format is incompatible.

h3. Workaround
See JSWCLOUD-16239 on importing to Jira Server and migrating from there.
Another option is to write your own script to transform the JSON from Bitbucket into the format accepted by Jira.
fields.summary: Cannot migrate Bitbucket Issues to Jira using exporter/importer

fields.description:
Currently the Revert PR button is only available within the Old Pull Request Experience. 
Users would like this to be implemented in the New Pull Request Experience as well.

Workaround is to use the old pull request experience to Revert PR merged.
fields.summary: Revert PR button missing in the new pull request experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users attempt to run pipelines with custom step & variables defined with their bitbucketpipelines.yml file. They are expected to be presented with a dialogue box that requests for them to choose the custom step and the corresponding custom variable.
 This is true when you run pipelines from:
 a. Commit section
 b. Branch section
 However, when users try to execute the pipelines from Run pipelines in the pipelines section as shown in the screenshot. The variable section doesn't show-up and the dialogue box is missing.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2019-11-05-17-46-41-017.png!
h3. Expected Results

!image-2019-11-05-18-17-58-468.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 : Define a custom step with custom variable as seen from this document
 Reference: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-bitbucket-pipelines-yml-792298910.html]
 # Step 2: From the repository > Choose Pipelines
 # Step 3: Try to execute run pipeline from the top right button reads "Run Pipeline"
 # Step 4: Choose the custom step and you will see that the custom variable doesn't pop up

h3. Workaround

Currently you can run pipelines with custom variables and the dialogue box from:
 a. Commits > Run pipeline
 b. Branch > (...) > Run pipelines
fields.summary: Running pipelines from the pipelines overview doesn't invoke custom variable dialogue box

fields.description:
It would be a useful feature if the "create repositories" permission could be limited for specific branch prefixes only.

For example, there would be a "feature" group and this "feature" group would have "create repositories" permission only to be able to create branches under the "feature/" branch prefix.
fields.summary: Limit "create repositories" permission to branch prefixes only
Getting raw file via CURL from a source repository is not giving the updated version

fields.description: As part of our testing procedure, we build large Docker containers. We would like to move these to Pipelines, but the cache limit prevents caching. We would like to increase the cache limit and are willing to pay for the storage.
fields.summary: Larger Docker cache limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deployment variables only accept values explicitly pre-defined in the deployment section according to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/set-up-bitbucket-deployments-968683907.html]. Users would like to be able to setup environments automatically using environment variables or just select an already created environment without editing the YAML file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup an environment variable called TARGET_ENV
 # Edit the YAML file with below example code
 {code}custom:
 variables:
 name: $TARGET_ENV
 step:
 deployment: $TARGET_ENV
 caches:
 node
 script:
 echo "Deploying to " $TARGET_ENV
 /bin/bash scripts/deploy.sh $TARGET_ENV
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Create a deployment environment and its variables if it still does not exist by defining it on the yaml file, either through an environment variable or giving it providing the deployment tag the name of a deployment environment that currently does not exist.

h3. Workaround

Manually create the deployment environment and setup the YAML file with that environment name.
fields.summary: Allow custom variables for deployment environment

fields.description:
On the branches panel there are two fields 'behind' and 'ahead' that show how many commits each branch is behind or ahead of the main branch.  I'd sort of hoped that clicking on either of these bars would take me to a panel that listed the actual commits. 

It seems you can get to the 'commits ahead' panel by clicking on the branch name.

Any chance this could be linked to from the 'ahead' field? 

If you make a panel for the 'behind' commits, could it be linked to the behind field?

See: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/How-do-I-tell-which-commits-a-branch-is-ahead-by/qaq-p/1216187?utm_campaign=&utm_content=post&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm#M48949] for background.
fields.summary: Links to behind/ahead on the branches page

fields.description:
From the /branches screen I can click on the name of any of the other branches and it brings up a detail panel showing a number of commits related to the branch.

The panel is actually showing the commits that are in the branch but aren't in the main branch.  There is, however, a big banner across the middle of the page saying 'This branch is 60+ commits behind the main branch'.  This makes me think, at a quick glance, that the page is showing all of the commits by which it differs from the main branch.

Can you change the wording to make it more obvious that it's only showing the commits by which the branch is ahead of the main thread?

Any chance of a filter so it'll show the ones the branch is behind the main branch by?

See: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/How-do-I-tell-which-commits-a-branch-is-ahead-by/qaq-p/1216187?utm_campaign=&utm_content=post&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm#M48949] for background.
fields.summary: Clarify content of Branch Detail View

fields.description: It would be great to have more information about the pipeline build such as % of success build or fail builds.
fields.summary: Pipeline build information dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cancel button on PR merge doesn't cancel the PR merge even if clicked immediately after clicking merge.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to open a pull request 
 # And perform a 'merge' operation using the merge button and immediately cancel the PR merge using the 'Cancel' button.

h3. Expected Results

Cancelling the PR merge should cancel the merge.
h3. Actual Results

Cancelling PR merge just closes the PR merge prompt and not cancel the merge.
fields.summary: Cancel button on PR merge prompt doesn't cancel the PR merge

fields.description:
I have a suggestion regarding the Merge Checks under Bitbucket Cloud. I will break this down into a few points below to paint the whole picture.

The crux of this suggestion is around a confusion that can happen here;
 !image-2019-11-01-14-13-43-021.png|thumbnail! 

I took a screenshot here so that I can explain the visual detailing behind this. I have come across situations where bitbucket users (myself included) *assumed* that merge checks would stop merges from happening based on the conditions set. Since I have tested this myself, I can understand the current perspective, but when as a person new to Bitbucket looks at this page, the first impression *seems* to be that the *checks* are *blocks*. The "preventing merge" is a standout premium feature and it is an amazing piece of work.

Having said that, I think we can try to change how the UI looks slightly to provide a better understanding for new Bitbucket users, purely because a wrong merge can be catastrophic. 
 I worked on a case recently, the users belonged to a startup and had set up the Bitbucket branch permission assuming that merge checks would block a merge from happening. 
 When a situation arose, they were surprised (and disappointed) that the merge went through without any of the checks stopping it.

This is the response from the same customer;
{panel}
*It would be great if you completely remove those settings since they serve
 no purpose on the free plan and are actually very dangerous. *
 We were under the False impression that a production branch was protected
 when it indeed was not.

I understand the value of the paid membership, but our startup is not at
 that point where we are generating any income yet.
 Hence very important that we do not lose any faith from any clients as they
 are carrying us month to month.
{panel}
*I do empathise with the second paragraph here*, I think as a company we all know how much we value our customers. I think this is a situation where we can take some action and slightly tweak the UI. 
 I do have a suggestion here as well; A link explaining how merge 'checks' work, one that *clarifies that merges will not be blocked on Free and Standard Plan, only checked.* 

 !image-2019-11-01-14-13-55-119.png|thumbnail! 

I have complete faith that a user can use the link and better understand the situation and design their SOP accordingly. This would help prevent such mishaps in the future.

What do you think?

Regards
 Manu Abraham
fields.summary: Bitbucket Merge Checks Feature

fields.description:
On Bitbucket's pull requests page, the drop-downs for _pull request status_, _author_, and _target branch_ are not labeled to indicate they are drop downs and are considered as text fields for accessibility software such as Apple's VoiceOver.

The same drop-down items cannot be navigated using the keyboard arrow keys or VoiceOver's navigation shortcuts, for example, as there is also no audio announcement of the values.
fields.summary: Improve accessibility for Bitbucket's pull request page

fields.description:
Right now, when you perform a build in Pipelines with chat notifications active, you will get a notification like the one below:

!Screen Shot 2019-10-31 at 16.04.27.png|width=471,height=155!

 

What happens is that when a build is re-run, the user who will be shown in the Slack message is whoever has committed the change, in the case of the screenshot, me.

However, who has triggered the build, in this case, was another user - This build is a re-run of another build.

This feature request is to change this message to state that the Pipelines build was triggered by whoever has re-run the build, not the committer of the change.
fields.summary: Change Slack notifications to show who has run the build instead of the commiter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a scenario where users want to access Pipelines Dashboard quickly with the URL, Pipelines didn't redirect to the login page to refresh the token.

(i) This used to work in the past but it currently returns a blank page (Attached to this case)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With incognito windows open, navigate to private repository's Pipelines Dashboard
[https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<reponame>/addon/pipelines/home|https://bitbucket.org/rchiapipeline/pipelinestest/addon/pipelines/home]

h3. Expected Results

It should redirect to the login page to refresh token then direct back to the Pipelines Dashboard page.
h3. Actual Results

It returns a blank page with no details about the repo:

!image-2019-10-31-14-41-13-820.png|width=232,height=298!
h3. Workaround

Navigate to bitbucket.org to refresh the access token, then access the Pipelines Dashboard again.
fields.summary: Pipelines dashboard returns blank page when the access token is expired and it didn't auto redirect to login page.

fields.description:
Currently there is no feature in Bitbucket UI which allow user to exclude their email address from Git signature for the commits made through UI. 

There should be a toggle option in UI which can allow user to decide whether they would like their email address to be part of Git signature or not for the commits made through UI.
fields.summary: Provide ability in Bitbucket UI to exclude email address from Git commit signature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

Improve ability in new PR view to jump from one diff to next within a PR when using the Screen Reader.  The old pull request view uses header elements to do this.
fields.summary: Simplify jumping from Diff to Diff in a PR when using Screen Reader

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, branches with special characters such as "è" are not being listed to manually run builds.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch with the "è" character in its name
# Go to either the branch pipelines page, select the referred branch
# Try to manually run a build.

h3. Expected Results

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2019-10-30-13-56-51-713.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results

 !image-2019-10-30-13-55-06-617.png|thumbnail! 

!image-2019-10-30-13-50-14-467.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

In order to avoid this issue, it is possible to:
# Create a new branch in the local repository without special character and push the same content that was in the original branch
# Create a new branch based on the branch with special character using Bitbucket UI
fields.summary: Branches with special character are not running manual builds

fields.description:
Hi friends.

Please, can you investigate how I get all users with groups and permissions in Bitbucket Cloud? I used the actual API but I just get the users belong to any group but I have users belong to repositories directly and I get in each attempt only 50 users, I need get all users in one time

Best Regards

Luis Cubas
fields.summary: Get all users with groups and permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- While reviewing Ruby files that have a literal array syntax using Bitbucket Cloud UI, we noticed that instead of rendering it in a visible color, it's picking a color very close to white (and since the background is white, the array becomes invisible). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1. Go to any Bitbucket Cloud repository
 2. Add file 
 3. Use any default ruby code that has a literal array (I've used only the class below that you can already see the issue). 
{code}
class TestingBugArray < ApplicationRecord
  INACTIVE_STATES = %i'Testing'.freeze
  ACTIVE_STATES = %i'Testing'.freeze
  SOLD_STATES = %i'Testing'.freeze
  CONFLICT_STATES = (%i'Testing' + SOLD_STATES).freeze
  CONFLICT_VALIDITY_DAYS = 60.freeze
{code}

 4. Change the Syntax mode to Ruby 
 5. Commit 

h3. Expected Results
- The color of the array shouldn't be white. 

h3. Actual Results
- Check screenshot attached

h3. Workaround

- Since there's no error message or blocker, the only workaround would be by highlighting the whole code to see all the hidden characters.
fields.summary: Ruby files rendering literal arrays with a color very close to white, becoming almost invisible.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Markdown syntax numeric list code block bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The below markdown syntax when filled with data does not parse accurately. The purpose is to have a numeric list and code blocks with it, and within the code block, there will be paragraphs of data separated by lines. The separated lines when previewed merges into a single line.
{code}

1. first point

    ```    
        code block
    ```
    
2. second point
    
3. third point

    ```
        code block
    ```
    
4. fourth point

{code}

h3. Expected Results
Ideally the numeric list should go 1,2,3,4 etc. 
The code block should contain the all the data between the triple backstrike.
And the different lines should not be merged together into a single line. 
h3. Actual Results
When used in conjunction one of the above mentioned expected results is not accurate, either the data is not parsed properly within the codeblock (even though it is within the ```) 
Or
The lines are combined into one. 

h3. Workaround

Instead of numeric lists, use manual numbering 1),2),3) etc
fields.summary: Markdown Codeblock Line Break in Numeric List

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket account fails to load the active Jira integrations under Account settings on the Safari browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce

On Safari Browser, go to "*Bitbucket settings*" > Under 'Atlassian Integrations' > choose '*Jira*'

!Screen Shot 2019-10-30 at 3.31.08 PM.png|width=712,height=593!
  
h3. Expected Results

!Screen Shot 2019-10-30 at 3.35.38 PM.png|width=461,height=83!
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2019-10-30 at 3.31.08 PM.png|width=229,height=192!
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to use safari in private browsing mode (OR) any other browser in a normal mode.
fields.summary: Jira integrations under account settings doesn't work on Safari browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a PR comment using the Old UI, if you upload an image then cancel it, the image is not being uploaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a pull request using the Old UI
# Add a new comment
# Click *Image* (from the toolbar)
# Click *Select an image*
# Choose an image (Once done, the image preview will show)
# Click *Select an image*
# Click *Cancel*
# Click *Upload*
(i) See the attached GIF file for the steps

h3. Expected Results
The image will be uploaded in the comment box

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when you click *Upload* button

h3. Workaround
Right now, the only workaround is to use the New Pull Request UI to upload an image in a comment
fields.summary: Uploading an image in a PR comment (using old UI) is not getting uploaded

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While commenting in Pull Requests, if you add an inline code block using backquotes (`), Bitbucket will render the text inside a code block, keeping both backquotes and erasing the first character in the text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Pull Request
# Leave a comment in the Pull Request using the inline code block functionality.
#* eg. `Code`

h3. Expected Results
Render the same imputed text in the inline code block
eg.
{code}
Code
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The following text is rendered:
eg. 
{code}
`ode`
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Select the text that should be in the inline code block and press CMD/CRTL + Shift + M
# Manually delete the backquotes and add the missing character.
fields.summary: Back quotes are not being rendered properly on Pull Request comments
Pulling commits from pull requests through API using pagination throws an error {"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Invalid page"}

fields.description: Add an option similar to "ignore whitespace" - "ignore code reformat". Only the new line in a different color should be shown in the results
fields.summary: rearrangeCode view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For a lot of Bitbucket endpoints, the schemas are unreadable/have missing information. We have been working around this by including examples for many of them, but not all of them have examples. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D]
 # See that the schema at the bottom has lots of "all of: object"s, which are too vague to understand. 
 # [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-API-missing-critical-information-am-I-missing-it-Where/qaq-p/1194119]

h3. Expected Results

We expect to have actual field names instead of "all of: object". 
h3. Actual Results

See above
h3. Workaround

Currently we have example responses listed in a lot of endpoints, but not all of them. When people scroll to the schema for this information, it's really difficult to read.
fields.summary: API documentation for various endpoints have schemas with missing information

fields.description: At this moment, it is not possible to generate hight level reports about the Pipelines builds from a repository. It would be good to have a report about the aggregate number of builds by day and whether or not they were successful, for example.
fields.summary: It would be good to have the ability to generate Pipelines builds report

fields.description:
Currently, the Bitbucket PR few does not show changes in the execute bit setting on a file. This means that the following kinds of errors are hard to detect as part of a code review:
 * scripts and Git LFS binaries being added without having their execute bits set correctly
 * scripts and Git LFS binaries losing their set execute bit when moved or renamed
 * other files incorrectly having their execute bit set

Git traditionally shows changes to the execute bit status by reporting a change in file permissions from 0644 to 0755 (or vice-versa), since checked out files are set as 0644 by default in the client, and only the execute bit is stored in the repo to request 0755 instead.

It would be perfectly fine if the Bitbucket UI support for this feature followed the same file permissions idiom that git itself uses (which was the request in BCLOUD-11961, but that was unfortunately misinterpreted as a request to *store* the full file permissions, and hence closed without action).
fields.summary: Show changes to execute bit status in diffs

fields.description:
We need this feature to re-deploy and run again if the target environment stopped some how.

 

Use case:

We are building docker images and pushing them to our registry with `BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER` as image tag. So we don't need any build artifacts left from pipe line build. And deploying those docker images to our docker server in a separate deployment step again using `BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER` so we need only variables from Deployment, Repo and Account and of course default pipeline variables from bitbucket.
fields.summary: Re-deploying a build to already deployed environment

fields.description:
We should able to promote a deployment directly to any environment without promoting previous deployment environments (steps).


We are only allowed to promote deployments to manually triggered deployment steps which are not skip-able, so we have to promote each step(environment) before we achieve the environment we want to promote the build.

Example:
{code:java}
pipelines:  
  branches:
    development:
      - step: *ecr-login
      - step: *build-and-push
      - step: *deploy-dev
      - step: *deploy-test-manual
      - step: *deploy-qa-manual
      - step: *deploy-staging-manual
      - step: *deploy-prod-manual
{code}
In above example if I wanted to promote to prod I have to promote test, qa, staging in that order manually. Instead I should able to promote the build which is successfully deployed to `dev ` environment to `prod` environment.
fields.summary: Allow Deployment Promotion to Any Environment

fields.description:
Hello!

As titled, my primary suggestions in relation tot his:
 * Improve Navigation or PRs by relocating "Files changed" section to the left-side of the page
 * Either lazy load the contents of Files changed or load them on selection from the "Files changed" list

One of the things I most sorely miss from FishEye+Crucible's Code Review UX is having the list of Files Changed on the left hand-side of with it's own scrollbar.

Made it much easier to go through files, or picking things back up if I wasn't done reviewing Code before merging a PR.

Navigation is severely hindered by the choice of placing "Files Changed" at the top and attempting to load every single file that has changed at once.

In large pull requests, these design decisions make the user experience tedious for what is otherwise and excellently built solution.

Thank you :)
fields.summary: Improve Navigation or PRs by relocating "Files changed" section to the left-side of the page

fields.description: It would be good to have the ability to prevent users from merging branches to a branch that has failed builds on it. Pretty much what we have now on the branch restrictions, but for the target branch.
fields.summary: Add branch restrictions to prevent merges on a branch that has failed builds

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Removing files from local repository does not change the download size of the repository
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a file to a repository locally
 # Commit the changes
 # Push to the remote (note the download size has changed)
 # Remove the file from the repository locally
 # Commit the changes
 # Push to the remote (note the download size has not changed)
 # Download the repository (note the downloaded file match the local repository size, not the remote).

h3. Expected Results

The repository size from download section  would match the downloaded file
h3. Actual Results

The repository size does not match the downloaded file
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Removing files from local repository does not change the download size of the repository
Custom pipeline variables with choice / enum

fields.description:
h3. Problem

As an admin, I need to be able to edit and remove tags from the Bitbucket UI.
fields.summary: Allow editing and removing tags from the UI

fields.description:
When Slack notifications are active for a Bitbucket account/repository, once a user comments on a pull request, for example, you receive an update through Slack regarding the comment posted.

Upon clicking on the _View Comment_ button on Slack notification, the user is redirected to the browser and prompted to log in using its credentials. It would be great if it was possible to authenticate the user using the SSH keys present on the user's computer.
fields.summary: It would be good to have the ability to authenticate to Bitbucket website through SSH

fields.description:
In order to make repository size tracking easier, it would be a good idea to send e-mail notifications to the users of a repository when its size reaches a certain threshold, instead of just notifying when the repo reaches the soft limit.

This would help repo admins manage and schedule repository maintenance, for example.
fields.summary: Send an e-mail notification when the repository size is reaching a certain point

fields.description:
I've been using the Bitbucket / Slack integration for a little while now and I think it would be a welcome addition if DMs were also part of the notification functionality.

Currently PRs go to a specified channel, which is great, but I am not always needed to review  every single PR that goes into that channel.

As a basic 1st piece of functionality I would like to receive a DM when something happens on a PR that I am specifically added as a reviewer on. This should run alongside the broader notification system for better general visibility.

Is this possible?
fields.summary: Send Direct Messages In Addition To Channels For PRs

fields.description:
Currently, we can add a group from a workspace to all repositories by going to the workspace settings > User groups > Click the group > Click More > Click *Update repositories access*.

However, this will add the group to all repositories.

*Feature request*:
 It would be best if we could allow admins to specify specific repositories where to add the group.
fields.summary: Ability to add a group to specific or selected repositories (not all)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Uploading a .webp picture in the issue trackers results with an "Only images are allowed." error message

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a .webp picture as a picture in a Bitbucket Issue tracker

h3. Expected Results
# The picture is uploaded

h3. Actual Results
# Error message mentioning: "Only images are allowed."

h3. Workaround

Convert the picture to JPEG/PNG and upload it
fields.summary: Uploading .webp as picture fails in Bitbucket Issues tracker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Bitbucket's UI 'git diff' does not match the results of a 'git diff' of newer versions of Git. The current 'git diff' used by Bitbucket matches older versions of Git.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Compare two commits through Bitbucket's UI
 # Compare two commits locally using the latest version of Git

h3. Expected Results
Both 'git diff's should be exactly the same

h3. Actual Results
Both results are different

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Bitbucket's 'git diff' does not match the 'git diff' of newer versions of Git

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Pull Request dashboard, the "Teams" filter is not working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Pull Request Dashboard [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests]
 # Select Filter by Teams.
 # Select a team from the dropdown.

h3. Expected Results
 # The filter should be applied and the only the PRs belonging to the selected teams should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
 # The filter is not applied. Pull requests belonging to all the team is displayed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: In the Pull Request dashboard, the "Teams" filter is not working.

fields.description:
Currently users don't have a solution through API/Tool to have the list of users exported between Server and Cloud for Bitbucket.

Workaround:
To have the users added manually either for Bitbucket Cloud or Bitbucket Server
fields.summary: Need tooling to help Migrate users from Cloud to Server

fields.description:
Merging with "Squash merge" we merge the changes to the main branch, but the commits still exists on the source branch and they're not reachable from the head of the main branch.

This works similar way with git log. If we execute "git log main_branch..branch1" in a local clone of such a repo where we merged branch1 to main_branch with Squash we will still see the list of commits that were merged with squash.

It would be a useful feature not to take into account those commits, which have been merged with Squash
fields.summary: Do not to take into account those commits that have been merged with Squash

fields.description:
In old pull request view, there is a provision to see comment counts and link next to each commit as shown in the following screenshot:

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-23 at 12.27.37 AM.png|thumbnail! 

However, there is no way to see this on New Pull Request View:

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-23 at 12.27.02 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add comment link and their count for commits in New Pull Request View

fields.description:
From time to time we have very big pull requests and would like to assign parts of them to different "field experts".

having the ability to assign different folders in a PR to different people to review would be very beneficial.
fields.summary: add an ability to assign segments of pull request to different reviewers

fields.description:
While using parameterised pipelines, we came across the situation where we write more steps to validate the variables, than for the build/release itself.

For example when releasing a new maven artefact, we enforce the user to provide the releaseVersion and the developmentVersion manually.

To ensure this, we currently run steps to regex validate each variable.

Allowing to provide a regex for variable validation, and validating it before starting the pipeline would be a great improvement

 
{code:java}
pipelines:
  custom:
    release:
      - variables:
          - name: releaseVersion
            regex: "[0-9]\\.[0-9]\\.[0-9]"
          - name: developmentVersion
            regex: "[0-9]\\.[0-9]\\.[0-9]-SNAPSHOT"
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "Releasing $releaseVersion"
            - echo "Preparing POM for $developmentVersion"
{code}
This would help reduce failed pipelines caused by user input errors, and provide more flexibility to the pipeline developer.
fields.summary: Support validation for custom pipeline variables

fields.description:
In Github they make it easy for users to edit and resolve merge conflicts in a file just by editing inline in the

Bitbucket seems to require manually pulling through repo and going through merge resolution steps even for simple merges like just extra sections of code being added from a previously merged pull request .
fields.summary: Ability to resolve simple merge conflicts in UI without manually pulling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After importing a list of issues to Bitbucket Issue tracker, the title sorting functionality will not sort by title/number and will instead order the issues according to how they are listed on the JSON file used on the import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new repository, activate the issue tracker and crate 3 issues
 # Export the tracker and extract the .zip file.
 # Open db-1.0.json and db-2.0.json files swapping the issues order
 # Compress the file back to a .zip
 # Import zip

h3. Expected Results
Listing issues by title would sort them by the title (issue number)

h3. Actual Results
Issues are sorted according to how they are listed on the JSON used for import.

h3. Workaround
Sorting issue by creation date should also sort it by the title, as the tile includes an increasing issue number on its title.
fields.summary: Issue tracker's title sorting does not sort by title for imported issues

fields.description: The word "Decline" comes with implications—request to make this "Close" instead. !EHatthxUcAI1XxB.png!
fields.summary: Change "Decline" to "Close"

fields.description:
Please consider increase the maximum number of environments in a repository.

Our services are currently present in several countries and therefore have the increasing need of currently adding new environments to our pipelines deployments. Right now we are close to reaching the limit and not being able to create new environments for our new customers.

This situation puts us in a very critical position since we will have to start looking for CI/CD alternatives shortly.
fields.summary: Increase number of environments limits

fields.description:
Currently while creating a repository, '*create new project*' suggestion only appears when there is a match with typed string and existing projects as shown below:

!Screen Shot 2019-10-21 at 7.38.27 PM.png|thumbnail!

Ideally, there should be an option when the typed string doesn't match any existing project:

!Screen Shot 2019-10-21 at 7.38.49 PM.png|thumbnail!

 

 It's the other way round at this time.
fields.summary: Create new project suggestion while creating repository

fields.description:
Github gives you the option to collapse any file-diff that you are no longer interested in see/review, this can be quite handy for `.lock` files (eg. yarn.lock/package-lock.json in javascript projects). 

video explanation:
[https://monosnap.com/file/8XxyhVULjhQFdUoRzy3mFUGk8LwLIy]
fields.summary: Ability to collapse file-diff

fields.description:
*Scenario-*
 * Create a repository and create a Pull request in it. Merge the Pull request.
 * Got to the commit view and and click on the *pull request #1* link in the commit message. It direct to the Pull request URL and will show all the changes in the *pull request #1*
 * Create fork of this repository and go to the commit view of the forked repository. You will observe that *pull request #1* is a plain text instead of a linkable content
 * Create a Pull request in the forked repository and merge it.
 * Go to commit view again in the forked repository and you will observe that there is one more *pull request #1* in the commit message which is linkable. The previous *pull request #1* is also linkable now. 

*Actual Result -* 
 * Click on new *pull request #1* in commit view and it will direct to the forked repository Pull Request #1 URL
 * Click on previous *pull request #1* in commit view and it will also direct to the forked repository Pull Request #1 URL

*Expected Result -* 
 * Click on previous *pull request #1* in commit view should direct to the *parent* repository Pull Request #1 URL
fields.summary: Fork repository PR link in commit message doesn't point to actual PR URL in parent repository
/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug} endpoint not working when no username is defined.

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to sort the repositories by the build status on our team repositories overview page, as we do run a lot of builds in different repositories and, it is hard to keep track of its results by checking it one-by-one.

 !image-2019-10-18-11-35-07-888.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to sort builds by build status on the repositories list

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Downloads section of the repo >> tab Branches, users have the option to download a zip with the files of the repo at the latest commit of each branch.

Sometimes users would need to download such a zip for earlier commits of a branch.

Additionally, they would like to be able to select multiple commits to create a single zip. In case the same file is changed in multiple commits of the ones selected, the user would like to have the most recent version in the zip.
h3. Suggested Solution

In the Downloads section of the repo >> tab Branches, allow users to select the commit(s) they want to download a zip for.

Additionally, allow users to select multiple commits and create a single zip. In case the same file is changed in multiple commits of the ones selected, the user would like to have the most recent version in the zip.
h3. Workaround

To download a zip file for older commits, a user can add a tag and they'll be able to download the zip file from the tab Tags in the Downloads page of the repo.
fields.summary: Allow users to download zip files with the repo files for older and also multiple commits

fields.description:
Currently: 
With the (read/write/admin) permissions we still see that users are able to download the repository.

Suggestion is to provide an option to restrict download permissions for users.
fields.summary: Restrict Repository Downloads

fields.description:
I am trying to review a Pull Request based on a bulk merge from a branch that has my code to a branch that doesn't. I don't need to review my own code; I need to review if the developer who raised the PR correctly resolved conflicts wherever manual conflict resolution was required.

Currently, I haven't found any way to do this in Bitbucket. I believe it would be an extremely useful feature for the Pull Request workflow.
fields.summary: In merge commits, show manually resolved conflicts

fields.description: Other platforms have the ability to press 't' when looking at a file in a pull request. This would be handy for big PRs. File filters save a lot of time in big PR and PR with build file on which no review is needed.
fields.summary: Ability to minimize/filter files in PRs

fields.description:
A more general use case for yaml anchors is to be able to pass variable values to the reference custom pipelines.  One way to do this would be to set up manual variables on the custom pipeline, and then set the values for those variables from the reference. There are likely other ways to approach this as well.

In some ways, this would also solve the use case in BCLOUD-19465 in a more general way.

Our current use case for this is to have a custom pipeline to run e2e tests against a deployment environment, but be able to parameterize that environment details (ie pass the url (or other parameters) to tell the custom pipeline what deployment environment to run the e2e tests against).

(I suppose this could be done with a custom pipe instead, but that seems like a lot of extra and external code, and it would be nice to have it all in the same repo).
fields.summary: Set variables for a yaml anchor reference

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to delete a branch that has more than 23 characters, the following will happen to its name on the delete modal:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-17 at 10.16.03.png|width=481,height=148!

As per the screenshot above, the branch name gets abbreviated if its name is larger than 23 characters long.

This feature request aims to change this behavior to make sure that, doesn't matter the number of characters, the complete branch name will be displayed in this modal OR add a tooltip to be able to see the complete branch name.
fields.summary: When deleting a branch with a long name on the branches page, the branch full name is not displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to view a single commit, using mac 2015-2017 with chrome, users are reporting slowness on responses and rendering the page.

h3. Environment
Google Chrome browser
Mac 2015-2017 versions
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a commit page with a big number of diffs (experienced with 300 lines)
 # Scroll down

h3. Expected Results
Page is rendered correctly while scrolling

h3. Actual Results
Diffs are not rendered.

h3. Workaround
Use another browser - we verified this worked in Safari and Firefox.
fields.summary: Opening a commit page with big number of diffs not rendering on Chrome for mac 2015/2017

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket lists Pull request statuses (Approved/Declined/Merged) at the repository level.
 We unfortunately don't have an API/UI option to list all the Pull request with respective status.
 This is useful feature for Developers working in a team.

Currently we don't have a work around for this.
fields.summary: Request to List all Rejected Pull Requests for a given Bitbucket account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the pull requests dashboard filters page (https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests), there are 4 different filters on the pull requests dashboard:

* Reviewing: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests
* Watching: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests?section=watching
* Mine: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests?section=created
* Teams: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests?section=teams
 
If you are already on one of the latter 3 filters (Watching/Mine/Teams), the links to filter for other types is broken and always redirects to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests - without the selected filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests
 # Select any of the other filters (Watching/Mine/Teams)
# Then select a different filter (Watching/Mine/Teams)

h3. Expected Results
# You will be redirected to the correct filter

h3. Actual Results
# You will be redirected to the *Reviewing* filter:  https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests

h3. Workaround
You'll need to click on the desired filter from https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests rather than from another filter.
fields.summary: The Pull request filters redirection is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the navigation panel on the left is collapsed and the cursor hovers near it not over it. It expands.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Collapse the navigation panel on the left
 # Hover near the collapsed panel 
 # The panel will expand

h3. Expected Results

The panel should expand only when the cursor has hovered over the panel.
h3. Actual Results

the panel expands only when the cursor hovers near the panel.
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Keep the panel expanded and do not collapse the panel.
fields.summary: Navigation panel on the left pops-out when hovering near it

fields.description:
I noticed that on larger files is very difficult to review changes made. I scroll down a bit, but oops, the page is not so responsive. There is no "Show next change" button,  Not to mention your web interface does not have all the features of a Windows Application like "Beyond Compare".

Can you integrate Beyond Compare or a similar tool so I can do the reviewing part on a Windows Application? Will be much faster and much more professional.

I don't mind using the rest of the functionality online.... Just the review changes part is too slow online.

 

Thanks, Bitbucket is nice.
fields.summary: Windows Application to Compare Files because Web Interface is very slow and ... not so great as an application
